svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: Tax revenue per capita and public health spending per capita in developing
Tax revenue is defined as compulsory transfers to the central government for public purposes. Public expenditure on health
care is defined as all the recurrent and capital spending from government, external borrowing and grants, and social health
insurance funds. Figures are adjusted for price level differences using PPPs.
Public expenditure on health care (per capita)
Source: Tax revenues per capita (PPP) in developing countries - WDI (World Bank), Health expenditure per capita PPP - World Bank (WDI) (2017)
